name: Reductive Logic: Beretta M9
description:
Though currently being phased out of use by the US military, the Beretta M9 became the standard sidearm of the Navy, Army, and Air Force in 1985.

The total number in possession by the US military is not known. In 2009, 450,000 units were purchased for $220,000,000 ($489 avg price). 15,778 more pistols were purchased for Afghan military and US Allies on September 30, 2011.  A year later, another 100,000 units were purchased.

The price of this work reflects the average price per M9 the US military paid in 2009 for its contract of 450,000 pistols over 5 years.

1080x1080p MP4 1 min loop

Model: "Beretta M9" (https://skfb.ly/6RW8z) by emran.bayati is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
